result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Carl Schmoldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Carl Schmoldt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Carl Schmoldt was found guilty of Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Brian Carl Schmoldt was found guilty of Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay any cost of counseling for the victim. To be paid before any court cost.
Defendant to pay court cost and cost of supervision during term of probation.

Defendant to undergo any treatment or counseling the agent deems appropriate. Defendant to submit DNA sample. Defendant to have no contact with the victim or victims family without permission of the agent. 
Defendant to comply with sex offender registry for 15 years.  
11-9-2016 Court modifies to allow the defendant to reside in his family home and to have unsupervised contact with his minor child. The defendant shall not be prohibited from having contact with persond under the age of 18, except for the victim in this case.

timeConds.notes: with huber may be allowed travel for employment. Defendant may serve in Green or Rock Counties if sheriffs can agree.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as in count # 3.
Concurrent with: count #3

Brian Carl Schmoldt, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek and Hal Harlowe.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Court has reviewed letters in support of the defendant, alternate PSI and reports . Special Prosecuter Luhman reviews the letters. S.E. makes a statement to the court. T.E. makes a statement to the court. M.E. reads a letter to the court. No restitution request filed as of today, but to be held  open. Brian Carl Schmoldt, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Hal Harlowe.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Plea Questionaire filed. Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Plea agreement . Defendant enters guilty plea to counts 3 and 4. Court dismisses counts 1,2 and 5 for failure to prosecute.  Court orders a PSI to be complete. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Attorney Harlow request 30 more days and the defendant will be ready to enter a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Brian Carl Schmoldt, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Kim Roegner. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant is waiving his preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over for trial. Information is filed; same charges. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant stands mute. Ms. Roegner is filing a substitution of judge in this case. Ms. Roegner is asking for modifications to the bond conditions. Court grants modification to conditions. Set over for DA Pre-Trial Conference on July 7, 2015 at 8:30am.

Violation - Expose Child to Harmful Material 4cts; Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity.  Issuing Agency - GCSD.    NO CONTACT WITH L.M.E.    No contact by Telephone or by Letter or through Third Person.    No contact in any manner except through Counsel.  NO CONTACT WITH: any person under the age of 18, except for his own children or unless his wife is present.    No contact with residence at N5884 Fiedler Rd, Albany WI or 8642 Ridge Dr, Belleville WI.  No use of electronic device with internet capability except in the course of employment for work purposes and to communicate and help his counsel with his case only.
